name: 25 Questions: General Knowledge 4 Multiple Choice Quiz | General

questions.text: What is a group of lions called?
Name Europe's highest volcano.
What inhabits an apiary?
What value is the Roman numeral XL?
Name the brother of Moses who was the first high priest of the Israelites in the Old Testament.
What is the groove under the nose called?
On which lake did Donald Campbell die during a world waterspeed record attempt?
In Roman Mythology name the messenger of the gods.
questions.explanation:
Mercury.

	The answers are members of the rock group Queen, Freddie Mercury, John Deacon, Brian May and Roger Taylor. The Signals (British army) use Mercury on their badges.

questions.text: In the film, 'Die Hard: With a Vengeance' (1995), what was the first name of the character played by Samuel Leroy Jackson?
Through which European country did Frankenstein's monster rampage in Mary Shelley's book?
Name the highest mountain in the Alps.
questions.explanation:
Mont Blanc.

	Monte Cervino is the Italian name for the Matterhorn.

questions.text: Complete the list: Utah, Omaha, Juno, Sword ....
questions.explanation:
Gold.

	Code names for the Normandy D-Day Beaches.

questions.text: Name the tail-less macaque that inhabits Gibraltar.
What river has its longest stretch as it flows through Germany?
questions.explanation:
Rhine.

	The Danube's German part is 687 km.  The Rhine's German part is 865 km.

questions.text: Name the town in South-West France where Bernadette Soubirous had visions of the Virgin Mary in 1858?
A Granny Smith is an Australian variety of ....?
questions.explanation:
Apple.

	Named after Maria Ann Smith, known as Granny Smith (died 1870), who first produced them at Eastwood, Sydney.

questions.text: Apart from the Earth, which is the only major planet not named after a Roman God?
questions.explanation:
Uranus.

	Uranus was the first Greek sky god. Mercury (messenger of gods), Venus (goddess of love), Mars (god of war), Jupiter (chief god), Saturn (god of farming), Neptune (god of water) and Pluto is not a planet.

questions.text: Which of the five Great Lakes means 'beautiful lake'?
The young of an elephant are called calves. The young of which of the following are NOT called calves?
questions.explanation:
Elephant seal.

	The elephant seal's young is called a weaner.

questions.text: Who wrote 'The Lair of the White Worm'?
Who was the captain of the Nautilus in the novel 'Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea'?
Which was the eldest of the March girls in Alcott's 'Little Women'?
questions.explanation:
Meg.

	Jo was the main character in this book, but she was the second born.  Amy, although she played a larger role than Beth, was the youngest.

questions.text: What was Hopalong Cassidy's horse called?
Which animal has translucent fur that masks the actual colour of their skin?
questions.explanation:
Polar bear.

	Polar bears have black skin to maximize absorption of the sun's rays. However, their fur is translucent and appears white due to the snowy habitat they live in. Polar bears in zoos appear more yellowish as they reflect more of the sun's rays.

questions.text: The koala, the two-toed sloth and the giant armadillo sleep 22, 20 and 18 hours a day respectfully. Which creature has a limited sleep time of about two hours per day?
questions.explanation:
Shrew.

	The shrew must constantly hunt and consume food or it will perish.  Hope you enjoyed the quiz.
